title: Product Manager, DashOps (f/m/x)
description:
About Gigs

Gigs is an operating system for mobile services. We unlock new revenue opportunities and enable seamless user experiences. From tech giants to innovative startups, we empower businesses to effortlessly embed telecom capabilities into their platforms. Gigs is a category creator in one of the world's largest industries—telecom.

We're backed by leading VCs such as Ribbit Capital, Google's Gradient, and Y Combinator, as well as industry leaders such as the CEOs of Uber, DoorDash, and Instacart.

Gigs has one of the most talent-dense, ambitious teams in the world who have been in key roles at category leaders like Stripe, Shopify and Airbnb and are now bringing their experience to build the same in telecom.

The position

The Product Manager for Dashboard & Operations Tooling will take over the Dashops team and drive the product roadmap needed to enable the kind of simple telecom operations & support that will allow Gigs and our customers to scale sufficiently to unlock the next 100-250M$ in ARR.

To do so, this person must deeply understand the operations of Gigs' and be able to identify and ruthlessly prioritize the highest impact improvements for Gigs' and our customers. Regulatory compliance across geographies is a foundational part of the Gigs offering, and this role is central to building this into our products and APIs.

To be successful, you must be skilled at product discovery, creating easy UX flows, writing clear copy, communicating with customers as well as cross-functionally, managing projects, creating roadmaps, prioritizing, influencing executives, and understanding legal compliance requirements. Our view is that dashboard and operational products shouldn't be boring, and infusing beauty, creativity and a bit of fun into our products is part of this role, too.

Key responsibilities include:


 * Build simple, lean, and effective workflows solving the most critical operational jobs to be done in collaboration with designers, engineers, customers and the compliance and legal teams
 * Identify and remove internal and customer time sinks and costly manual work with tools and automation
 * Understand and bake in compliance into the Gigs platform across geographies
 * Prioritize a roadmap of features, balancing short-term benefit and long term vision
 * Influence decisions higher up in the organizational structure and across teams.
   
   

About you

We know that perfect candidates don't exist. Even if not all of this applies to you, we'd love to learn more about you.


 * Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
 * At least 5 years of experience in product management
 * Excellent analytical, communication and problem-solving skills
 * Hands on mentality: You take ownership and move projects forward while keeping everyone in the loop, over-communicating in a remote work environment.
 * Able to juggle many competing priorities at once without getting overwhelmed
 * Empathy for our customers, internal operations, and customer support teams
 * Fluency with data: You are familiar with data analytics tools and able to conduct your own analysis to prioritize features and show their impact.
 * You are able to quickly dive into the world of telecom, operations and support and understand your users and their needs well
 * You enjoy working with cross-functional teams and managing complex projects.
   
   

Bonus points if:


 * You have worked in the telecommunications space before
 * You have worked in a team that enabled support or operations team before and product-managed internal or support tooling
 * You have worked in a fast-growing, startup before
 * You have worked in a remote environment before
 * You are familiar with Figma and have worked in a kanban-style environment
   
   

Remote Work at Gigs

At Gigs, we're remote-friendly, with a strong emphasis on meaningful in-person collaboration. While most of our work is done remotely, we encourage our team to connect regularly in our hubs, whether for focused teamwork, customer meetings, or brainstorming sessions that drive creativity.


 * Gigs Pads: Our hubs in San Francisco, London, and Berlin are designed for teams to come together when needed—whether to collaborate on projects, meet customers, or simply change the scenery.
 * Gigs Republic: Twice a year, the entire company gathers for in-depth team bonding, strategic sessions, and shared experiences to reinforce our culture and drive growth.
   
   

This blend of remote work and in-person collaboration ensures we maintain a dynamic, connected, and innovative team environment.

What We Offer

At Gigs, we believe in rewarding excellence. You'll receive competitive compensation and stock options to ensure you are truly part of our growth. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include stipends for upgrading your home office or work setup, learning and development budgets to support your career growth and a free phone and international data plan (naturally).

If you're excited about pushing boundaries and helping us shape the future of telecom, we'd love to hear from you.

For more information on benefits, Gigs Pads, and life at Gigs, check out our Careers page.

title: Product Innovation Manager, Europe
description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa

Job Description

Shopping habits are changing – transacting online is becoming more popular than face to face, we are shopping on/with different devices and, have more choices to pay for our goods/services. Visa is evolving its own capabilities to benefit from these changes, but also shaping and accelerating the shift by bringing to market new payment experiences.

Visa’s product innovation team is responsible for commercializing new propositions and product and shape the future of commerce. This team is formed by experts coming from diverse background of product management, architecture, design and research. The Product Manager Innovation will report into a senior product manager and, will be responsible for representing the business perspective of the solutions and, drive commercial outcomes.

In its day to day working this role will interact with internal and external stakeholders. Internally, the person will work with designers, technical experts and engineers to create and refine new payment experiences. Externally, the person will evangelize solutions to a diverse set of Visa’s clients such as merchants, acquirer, processors and financial institutions for commercial adoption.

Responsibilities:


 * Work with clients and interdisciplinary teams of product, design, and engineering in the development of new use cases/PoCs, applying a digital-first mindset and the contemporary product management techniques of digital native companies (e.g., human centered design, minimum viable product, rapid prototyping, etc.) Lead the business perspective on relevance to Visa, business modeling/case. Articulates the “Business Challenge” at the beginning of the project to ensure potential user and business impacts are relevant and defined early (e.g., what problem are we trying to solve? What impact do we want to have? What are possible solutions? What context and constraints do we need to keep in mind?)
 * Participate in the delivery of a range of projects that could vary based on personna, problem/opportunity defined
 * In partnership with design and technology determine the gap to explore, test, refine, and recommend a final solution.
 * Work with designers + design technologist to make things tangible/real versus theoretical
 * Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of Visa’s capabilities, payments, commerce ecosystem, think holistically about the design of a new offering and the implications related to both the customer’s experience as well as the organization’s ability to implement and scale
 * Articulate the desirability, viability and feasibility of recommendations.
 * Support client engagements cycles (from selling, scoping, research, client delivery and go-to-market).
 * Use project management, facilitation to inspire the joint Visa + client / partner team to deliver their best
 * This role will report into the Director of Product Innovation, Europe and will be based in Berlin, with exposure to key stakeholders and leadership across Visa Inc.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Graduate degree or higher qualification.
 * Experience in commerce & payments (card/non card), new product design, or financial services product development
 * Banking, fintech, merchant/acquirer side experience required
 * Product design/development experience, with a strong track record in innovative new product development, problem solving, scaling pilots to commercialization
 * Data informed to create business cases , well versed in market research and business analytics
 * Expertise in innovation and product development methodologies from applied Human-centered design(HCD) to service design, and agile (SAFe) scrum
 * Must have a mindset that embraces creativity, optimism, ambiguity and failing-fast
 * Comfortable interacting, interviewing and iterating with people through exploration of new concept, prototyping (low and high) and testing
 * Ability to be client-facing, specifically to design, facilitate and execute on complex client engagements and pilot sprints
 * Proven ability executing go-to-market for new product pilots with OKR and optimization strategies
   
   

This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

The Product Manager serves as the primary resource, collaborating with the sales team and local influencers to ensure strong market penetration and brand recognition.

 * Define and support the strategic direction of the product category in collaboration with the Strategic Business Unit and commercial leader.

 * Lead initiatives for new product development, including test market evaluations, design control processes, and product launch plans.

 * Provide high-level support for sales inquiries beyond Customer Service's scope; ensure all necessary information is available to address customer needs effectively.
 * Develop tactical promotion plans in partnership with the communications team, manage pricing compliance, and analyse promotion results.
 * Oversee the development and updates of digital content, catalogues, sales aids, and training materials for the product line.
 * Monitor product and unit sales, forecast product demand, and contribute to quarterly and annual sales projections for assigned products.
 * Ensure adherence to ISO/CE requirements and participate in conventions as a product expert.




Requirements:

title: Product Manager

What You’ll Be Working On

 * Designing and delivering a reliable, scalable platform that supports our product vision
 * Enabling customers and partners to integrate with our platform
 * Ensuring effective access to data across our platform
 * Meeting enterprise expectations in security and compliance
 * Supporting the adoption of generative AI within our product

How you'll work


 * You’ll be part of an empowered cross-functional team given the freedom and autonomy to solve real customer problems. Our ways of working are heavily influenced by the work of Marty Cagan/Silicon Valley Product Group, which will give you a good sense of how you and the team will work

At mama health, we're not just building software - we're building the future of healthcare. You'll take the lead on our Patient App, our consumer-facing product, ensuring it delivers a seamless, impactful experience for chronic patients while meeting our business goals.

This is not a role for the weak of heart. We need a BUILDER - someone who isn't afraid to get their hands dirty, challenge the team and own the product roadmap from idea to delivery. If you're ready to push boundaries and take full ownership of a critical product, read on.

Your profile

 * Own the Patient App roadmap: define the vision, prioritize features and ensure delivery meets our strategic goals.

 * Advocate for the patient: understand user needs deeply and ensure the app provides real value to chronic patients.
 * Work with leadership: align product initiatives with company strategy and key business objectives.
   
   

What we're looking for


 * Experience in healthcare: ideally with consumer-facing apps or patient-centric solutions.
 * Start-up mindset: you’re energized by building from scratch and thrive in fast-paced, high-pressure environments.
 * Execution-focused: you take ownership, push boundaries and make things happen.
 * A Leader and a Doer: you know how to rally a team and get into the details to solve problems.
 * Strong communicator: you can articulate the “why” and “how” to all stakeholders.
 * Willingness to work hard: we’re being upfront – this role requires commitment beyond normal working hours to succeed.
   
   

Why us?


 * Make a real impact: you’ll work on a product that directly improves the lives of chronic patients.
 * Ownership and autonomy: you’ll own the product end-to-end and have the opportunity to shape it as we grow.
 * Collaborate with top talent: you’ll work with a driven team passionate about transforming healthcare.

This is your chance to lead a product that will change lives. Join mama health and own the future of patient-focused healthcare.

About Us

Our mission is to organize the world's patient experiences and make them universally useful. By leveraging advanced AI and process mining technologies, we conduct in-depth conversations with patients to build comprehensive models of disease progression. At mama health, we are dedicated to improving patient care, driving education, and fostering impactful collaborations across the healthcare industry.

Entrepreneurial spirit

We seek exceptional talent with the drive, passion, and creativity to shape the future of our company. This isn’t a place for those seeking routine tasks or detailed instructions. If you’re eager to influence the future of healthcare with your ideas and contributions, mama health is the place for you.

Results-driven culture

We operate by objectives and reward exceptional performance. Goals are clear and accountability is key. If you miss your targets, we expect you to step up and put in the extra effort. When you achieve them, take the time to recharge and celebrate your success.

As a company addressing chronic diseases worldwide, we are building an international, diverse team. Our employees bring together a mix of medical, technical, and business expertise, representing over five nationalities. We value the insights of those living with chronic conditions—both within our team and in the broader patient community. Their lived experiences inspire and guide our work, helping us create solutions that truly meet patients’ needs.

title: (Junior) Product Manager Financial Services (d/w/m)
description:
Paymenttools hat es sich zur Aufgabe gemacht, die Zahlungslandschaft für Händler in Europa zu verändern. Mit mehr als 4,4 Milliarden Besuchern pro Jahr in unseren mehr als 15.000 REWE Group Märkten und Reisebüros in 21 Ländern wissen wir genau, was Verbraucher und Händler brauchen, wenn es ums Bezahlen geht. Wir glauben fest daran, Zahlungen nahtlos und unsichtbar zu machen und sie mit Vale Added Services im Rahmen eines zuverlässigen Identitätsdienstes zu verknüpfen. Unser Mantra: #wesolvepayn. Wir verbinden modernste Technologie mit strenger Sicherheit, um sensible Zahlungsdaten zu schützen und gleichzeitig Innovationen in einer Cloud-nativen Technologieumgebung zu fördern.

Als Product Owner bist Du der zentrale Knotenpunkt, der Vision und Realität verbindet. Du arbeitest eng mit unserem UX/UI-Designer und dem Engineering-Team zusammen, um intuitive Benutzererfahrungen und leistungsstarke Produkte zu schaffen. Gleichzeitig spielst Du eine entscheidende Rolle in der Dateninteraktion, indem Du sicherstellst, dass diese in wertvolle Insights und ansprechende Frontends integriert werden.

Wir bieten dir die Chance, Dich weiterzuentwickeln und in einem innovativen Team zu arbeiten, das Dich auf dem Weg zum/zur erfolgreichen (Junior) Product Owner (d/w/m) im Bereich Merchant Center und Financial Reporting unterstützt. Bei Paymenttools übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für die Finanzdaten unserer Kunden, deren Aufbereitung und Controlling. Du verwaltest und entwickelst gemeinsam mit deinem Team unsere Reconciliation-, Reporting- und Data-Analytics-Produkte weiter.

Wir suchen eine motivierte und visionäre Persönlichkeit, die dazu beitragen möchte, unsere Produktpalette auf ein neues Level zu heben und unseren Kunden echten Mehrwert zu bieten.

Deine Aufgaben


 * Du bringst Leben in die Welt der Daten, indem du eng mit unserem Engineering-Team zusammenarbeitest, um Rohdaten in aussagekräftige Berichte zu verwandeln.
 * Das umfasst die Arbeit an Lösungen innerhalb unseres Financial Services Bereichs und die Unterstützung bei der Umsetzung der Produkt-Roadmap in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Engineering, Design und anderen funktionsübergreifenden Teams.
 * Du bist neugierig darauf, zu verstehen, welche Finanzdaten wir erhalten und wie wir diese unseren Kunden visuell besser vermitteln, insbesondere ihre Wünsche sowie ihre Anforderungen an das Reporting unterstützen können.
 * Du unterstützt außerdem unser internes Berichtswesen und die Rechnungsstellung, indem du unsere Prozesse und Daten übersichtlich sowie automatisiert aufbereitest.
 * Du bereitest wichtige Daten und Reportings für anstehende Audits vor und stellst sie unseren internen Teams zur Verfügung.
   
   

Deine Erfahrungen


 * Du hast bereits erste Erfahrungen als Product Manager / Owner oder in einer ähnlichen Rolle gesammelt, Tech-Unternehmen oder SaaS-Startups sind von Vorteil.
 * Du bist interessiert und erfahren im Umgang mit ein- und ausgehenden Daten, die unser Geschäft und das unserer Kunden direkt beeinflussen (z.B. Reporting, Reconciliation und Rechnungsstellung).
 * Du verfügst über sehr gute Excel-Kenntnisse, hast Spaß an der Arbeit mit Excel und kannst komplexe Daten effektiv aufbereiten und präsentieren.
 * Du hast ein Auge für die Gestaltung ansprechender UX/UI-Frontends und bist neugierig darauf, deine Fähigkeiten in diesem Bereich zu entwickeln. Die Erfahrung im Bauen von UX/UI Designs ist ein Plus.
 * Du verstehst die Anforderungen im Bereich Finance aus der Sicht des Kunden und setzt diese entsprechend um.
 * Du verfügst über ausgezeichnete Kommunikationsfähigkeiten: Du kommunizierst gut in Wort und Schrift auf Englisch UND Deutsch.
 * Ein Hintergrund im Finanz- oder Rechnungswesen ist wegen der Art der Daten in dieser Rolle von Vorteil, aber keine Voraussetzung
   
   

Wir bieten Dir die Chance, dich weiterzuentwickeln und in einem innovativen Team zu arbeiten, das dich auf dem Weg zum erfolgreichen (Junior) Product Owner (d/w/m) im Bereich Merchant Center und Financial Reporting unterstützen wird.

Deine Benefits


 * Deutschland-Ticket, subventioniertes Abonnement
 * Rabatte auf Reisen, Mode, Technik und mehr durch unsere Corporate Benefits
 * REWE Rabattkarte für Preisnachlässe bei Einzelhändlern der REWE-Gruppe
 * JobRad, günstiges Fahrrad Leasing!
 * Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
 * Versicherungsdienstleistungen
   
   

Vorteile, wenn Du mit uns arbeitest


 * Wir arbeiten hybrid
 * Flexible Arbeitszeiten, die zu Deinem Arbeitsablauf passen, Deine Zeit ist wichtig!
 * Verantwortung vom ersten Tag an
 * Arbeite mit moderner und agiler Software wie Google Workspace, Slack, Asana, Jira, Lattice, Miro und Confluence
 * Firmenevents wie Hackathons und Company Days (Frag bei Interesse dazu gerne bei uns nach!)

Working in the product & tech team at Doctolib involves building innovative products and features to improve the daily lives of care teams and patients. We work in feature teams collaborating with engineering, design, and business teams.

What You’ll Do

We are looking for a Senior Product Manager (x/f/m) to join our teams working on the prescription module inside our clinical Software.

As a Senior Product Manager (x/f/m), your mission will be to shape a prescription module that will transform the way practitioners and patients experience this key moment of the care path. We want to radically change the way prescription is currently done by:


 * Reducing the medical errors and contributing to the governments’ initiatives in terms of drug consumption reduction
 * Making the process of creating prescriptions more easy than ever before (suggestions, access to information for the caregivers etc..)
 * Having a holistic approach and leveraging Doctolib’s assets to improve the drug adherence.
   
   
   

Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:


 * Understand the needs and context of key players of the prescription experience (doctors, medical assistants, pharmacists, patients) using qualitative (field trips, interviews, prototype testing…) and quantitative data across several countries and clusters
 * Know and Incorporate the regulations constraints of each country to make sure we are compliant whilst remaining easy to use.
 * Analyze the competitive landscape, business and technical context through benchmarking and research
 * Define the vision, own the product strategy and translate them into clear and measurable objectives.
 * Build a prioritized roadmap and product plan to deliver this vision in a scalable way, taking into account Doctolib’s growth plan.

 * Are ambitious to transform healthcare and willing to learn about this market. Already having knowledge of it is a plus.

title: Digital Product Manager (m/f/d)
description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Unser Ziel ist eine Solaranlage auf jedem Dach, ein Speicher in jedem Haus, und ein E-Auto in jeder Garage. Wie wir das schaffen? Enpal macht Solar endlich einfach: Wir vermieten Solaranlagen, Stromspeicher und Wallboxen zum All-inclusive-Tarif, ergänzt um einen günstigen Ökostromtarif, und intelligent vernetzt zu einer integrierten Gesamtlösung.

Auf unserem Weg zum größten Energieunternehmen Europas stehen wir gerade erst am Anfang. Deshalb sind wir auf der Suche nach Talenten, die uns auf diesem Weg begleiten, ihren Fußabdruck hinterlassen und Erfolge gemeinsam mit uns feiern. Bei uns findest Du ein dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld, genauso wie den Raum, Dich persönlich und fachlich weiterzuentwickeln und Deine Stärken wirkungsvoll einzusetzen.

Als erstes grünes Unicorn in Deutschland und wachstumsstärkstes Energieunternehmen in Europa (FT1000 Ranking 2022 von Financial Times & Statista) treiben wir unsere Mission von grüner Energie für alle weiter voran. Sei auch Du Teil dieser Erfolgsgeschichte und verändere mit uns gemeinsam die Welt!

Stellenbeschreibung


 * Du verantwortest die (Weiter-)Entwicklung unserer digitalen Produkte end-to-end: von der Auswertung unserer User Experience, über die Entwicklung von Konzepten, das Durchführen von Tests bis hin zum Livegang.
 * Du bist die Schnittstelle zwischen Kundenberatung, Handwerker-Teams sowie Marketing und Geschäftsführung: aus Deinen Ideen und dem Input Deiner Stakeholder entstehen die digitalen Konzepte und Deine User Stories.
 * Mit einem Team von Produktmanagern, Software-Developern und UX-Designern entwickelst Du komplett neue Tech-Lösungen im Energiemarkt und setzt regelmäßig neue digitale Features um in agilen Scrum- und Kanban-Prozessen.
 * Du definierst KPIs, überprüfst selbstständig den Erfolg Deiner Projekte und bist erste/r Ansprechpartner/in für die Umsetzung von Trainings der Stakeholder und End-User.
   
   
   

Qualifikationen


 * Du bringst 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich digitales Produktmanagement mit
 * Du hast eine hohe Internetaffinität und als Digital Native großes Interesse an Tech-Lösungen & Digitalisierungsprozessen und / oder Usability & user-centered Design
 * Du hast Hands-On Mentalität, sehr gute Analysefähigkeiten und magst Herausforderungen in einem dynamischen und jungen Unternehmensumfeld
 * Du sprichst Deutsch und Englisch verhandlungssicher
 * Wir freuen uns zudem über Erfahrungen mit Jira, Miro, Tableau, SalesForce
   
   
   

Zusätzliche Informationen


 * Arbeite in Deutschlands erstem grünen Unicorn und gestalte aktiv die solare Energiewende mit.
 * Die Sonne scheint auf der ganzen Welt - Bei Enpal findest du ein hochmotiviertes und diverses Team, mit mehr als 65 verschiedenen Nationalitäten.
 * Lieber dem Haustier daheim oder den Kolleg:innen im Büro Gesellschaft leisten? Auch nach der Pandemie bieten wir dir ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell.
 * Wir erfüllen jedes Startup-Klischee - In unserem modernen Office in Berlin-Friedrichshain findest du von Tischtennisplatte und Yoga-Ecke bis Dachterrasse und gefüllten Getränkekühlschränken alles was das Herz begehrt.
 * Dein Kick-start bei Enpal - Lerne an deinem Onboarding-Tag das Unternehmen, deine Teamkolleg:innen und unseren Gründer Mario kennen.
 * Bleib auf dem Laufenden - Egal ob Unternehmenszahlen bei unseren monatlichen All-Hands-Meetings oder die Funktionsweise einer Photovoltaikanlage beim Lunch & Learn, du weißt immer genau Bescheid.
 * Energiewende geht nur gemeinsam - Bei Enpal erwartet dich ein legendärer Teamspirit und unvergessliche Teamevents.
 * Ohne Fehler kein Fortschritt - Wir leben eine starke Feedback-Kultur und wachsen mit deinem Input, entweder auf persönlichem Weg oder anonym über unser Feedback-Tool Culture Amp.
 * Wir bei Enpal sind stolz auf die Vielfältigkeit unseres Teams. Weder bei der Einstellung noch während des Beschäftigungsverhältnisses werden Entscheidungen auf Basis von Hautfarbe, Religion oder religiösen Glaubens, ethnischer oder nationaler Herkunft, Nationalität, Geschlechteridentität, sexuelle Orientierung, Behinderung oder Alter getroffen. Enpal steht für einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz und geht gegen Diskriminierung und Belästigung jeglicher Art vor.

title: Product Manager - Conversion Programs
description:
At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.

Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.

Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.

About The Team And Role

This role is part of the Conversion Programs team and will drive customer facing communications flows. You will serve as the portfolio owner, including revenue targets, long-term strategy, roadmap, and execution. You will iterate and expand on various programs, primarily in the channels of Email, Push Notifications and the Native App Notification Hub. You’ll bring it all to life in close collaboration with your immediate partners: engineering, design, data science, and analytics teams! This is a highly visible role and you will work closely with various cross functional teams within eBay mainly on the Core Technology/Core Product side.

If you are passionate about strategising for the marketplace economy, building highly contextual customer experiences in owned channels, and working in an agile manner with brilliant counterparts, come join us!

What You Will Accomplish


 * The ‘CEO’ of your experience: defining and communicating the vision, strategy, and roadmap for the owned communications portfolio.
 * Build the roadmap in close collaboration with leadership and other team members.
 * Implement the roadmap by working with engineering, data science and design teams. Build MVPs, iterate fast and be the champion of execution perfection.
 * Deep knowledge of eBay and its products with domain expertise in the marketing channels of Push Notifications and Email.
 * Writing requirements and communicating them to the Engineering teams
 * Conducting AB tests: hypothesis building, test design, critical metric definition
 * Working with analytics teams to measure the impact on success metrics
 * Collaborating with creative team to improve content and design
 * Collecting and analyzing customer and user feedback to improve the product.
 * Prioritizing features and work items based on business value, user needs, and other criteria.
 * Conducting market research and competitor analysis to find opportunities and threats.
 * Facilitating communication and collaboration between the development team and partners.
 * Tracking and reporting on your experience performance and key metrics.
 * Continuously improving the roadmap and development processes.
   
   
   

What You Will Bring


 * Strong product / business / marketing experience. Marketplace experience is strongly preferred.
 * Technical Product Management experience or comparable experience working directly with Engineering teams (both front-end and back-end); technical understanding of building products / communications from scratch.
 * Experience in developing email and native app notifications.
 * Experience navigating highly sophisticated cross-functional projects end-to-end.
 * Strong experience owner sense - ability to understand consumer needs and find simple and creative ways to address them.
 * Metrics driven - ability to build actionable metrics which can measure experience performance.
 * Builds positive relationships across various teams within eBay; an active listener and clear communicator; can lead by influencing.
   
   
   

Technical Skills


 * Building 0 to 1 products
 * Prioritization
 * Agile and scrum methodologies + Jira
 * Writing Technical Product Requirements
 * A/B testing / Experiment design / Data analysis
 * E-commerce
 * Conversion / Retention / User flow optimization
 * Mobile apps / Email / Notifications
 * Familiarity with Data Science and Machine Learning
 * Market / Driven Research
 * Basic copywriting skills are a plus

title: Program/Product Manager Intern
description:

Our primary purpose is to make our customer´s lives easier. You will contribute to that purpose by conducting data analysis and deep dives to generate insights into system behaviour, on top of identifying performance gaps and improvement potentials for Amazon's most strategic brands. You will optimize visibility across our website and activate marketing channels with the objective of increasing customer conversion and retention.

How often can you say that your work changes the world? At Amazon, you’ll say it often. Join us and define tomorrow’s innovations in e-commerce.

Key job responsibilities

Work alongside a Vendor Manager to help provide a suite of services designed to maximize business performance and grow sales. Vendor Managers build relationships with Amazon Retail Vendors who sell products wholesale to Amazon and are one of our key business partners in the Retail organization.

Support in the definition, conceptualization, implementation and growth of strategic programs and products aiming at digitizing the procurement landscape.

Dive deep into large data sets to analyse trends, identify new customer insights and turn these insights into action.

A day in the life

Your Paid 3 - 6 Month Internship Includes

Mentorship: we care about your career aspirations and strive to assign projects based on your interests. You can learn and be curious with access to unlimited virtual trainings on project management, personal brand, communication skills and many more.

Extra perks for Amazonians such as: exclusive Amazon.de discount; Deutschlandticket (Transportation Ticket); bike rental; gym membership discount; Beta testing on new Amazon products; and free mental health, legal, and financial support for you and your family.

Get involved: we have with over 13 Amazon Affinity Groups you can join and become an ally to a cause close to your heart (sustainability, diversity, LGBTQ+, mental and/or physical disabilities, local community initiatives, etc.)

Taking ownership of your career: because when you succeed, we all win. A successful internship, could lead to a full-time (graduate role) after finishing your university studies.

About The Team

At Amazon Retail, we help improve the selection and shopping experience and offer customers around the world exciting products and deals. As a Marketing intern, you will be part of one of our product categories which go from books to fashion, electronics to grocery, movies and music to toys and health & beauty, and everything in between.

From a garage-based start-up in 1995 to a top global brand today, Amazon has evolved and made its way into our lives. Amazon Retail is at the heart of that journey. Join us and become part of it.

EU Student Programs Teams

Basic Qualifications


 * Available to commence an internship between January and December 2025. Yes, our start dates are flexible! You should then be available between 3 and up to 6 months, full time (40h/week). Internship length is subject to availability.
 * Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree, with an anticipated graduation date after the completion of your internship.
 * Fluent written and verbal communication in English (Level - C1 or higher).
 * You will be based in Berlin for the duration of the internship. A relocation package may be offered, subject to an eligibility criterion.

 * Studies within Business, Marketing, Economics, Engineering or similar fields.

 * Every day will be filled with developing new skills and achieving personal growth. Interested?

Interviews consist of behavioral questions and a case study, focusing on our Leadership Principles. The entire recruitment process typically takes 3 to 4 weeks. Do note that the selection process and timelines are subject to change, and vary with role and location.

description:
Learning is the only human superpower. It's a gateway through which knowledge becomes a virtue, a value, a product, a skill, a prerequisite, a motive, and a competitive advantage.

LearnWorlds' vision is to enable individuals, businesses, and communities to leverage the power of learning, improving lives and cultivating a brighter, more resilient future for everyone.

Our mission is to stand out as the ultimate adaptable e-learning solution, tailored to meet the diverse, advanced and intricate business models of contemporary organizations.

We are committed to delivering unmatched flexibility in our offerings, ensuring that businesses, individuals, and communities can effortlessly embrace knowledge empowerment as a cornerstone of their growth and success.

The cloud-based e-learning platform offers tailor-made solutions, from creating whole e-learning websites to author online courses as well as providing the right tools to sell them on a B2B/B2C function. Today, LearnWorlds has c.9000 customers in more than 140 countries and our team is fully remote. However, we also offer the option of working from the office for those who want to mix things up. We have offices in Athens, Crete, and Limassol.

About The Role

We are seeking an experienced Integrations Product Manager to lead the strategic development of the LearnWorlds' integration ecosystem.

In this role, you will focus on identifying and prioritizing valuable integration opportunities that enhance the value of our platform, streamline workflows, and create growth opportunities for LearnWorlds and its customers.

You will drive the full lifecycle of integrations, from market research and strategic planning to delivery and post-launch optimization. You will play a key role in shaping LearnWorlds' integration strategy to enable customer success, improve retention, and expand market reach. You will work closely with partnership managers, product marketing, and engineering to ensure that our integrations suite drives user adoption, improves retention, and opens new market opportunities

This is an exciting opportunity to work in a collaborative and dynamic environment, interacting with cross-functional teams, integration partners, and our customers to deliver exceptional value.

Responsibilities

As the Senior Product Manager for Integrations, you will:


 * Identify and evaluate potential integration opportunities aligned with business objectives, customer needs, and market trends.

What You Need To Succeed


 * Extensive experience in Product Management and Growth, preferably delivering mobile apps of a significant scale in industries such as e.g. Gaming, B2C E-Commerce, Social or comparable.
 * Knowledge and preferably experience in building products that became a part of people’s daily habits with focus on behavioral design.
 * Sound understanding of activation, onboarding and retention strategies and ability to understand complex problem spaces.
 * Passion for building products that impact millions of people with innovation as the norm – jobs to be done mentality is not an unknown word to you.
 * Analytical mindset with solid understanding of using a data-informed approach to problem solving.
 * Strong knowledge of A/B testing and key validation methods.
 * Very good command of English, both spoken and written. German and/ or Arabic is a plus.
   
   

Why Jodel


 * No one else is doing what we're doing - it's that simple. We're pioneering local communication and since communication is a basic human need, our work is just very very exciting. On top of that, we are one of the few large scale European Social Networks. There’s not that many and we're very proud to be "Made in Europe".
 * Attractive Compensation package - Competitive salary and benefits package and optional participation in the employee stock option plan.
 * Your way of working - Find your best way to work with our remote-friendly hybrid working solution! We offer a flexible remote working framework to suit your needs. Depending on the role and business needs with attendance in our beautiful, re-designed office in the heart of Berlin (Checkpoint Charlie), complete with professional coffee machine, free drinks and snacks and break spaces along with kicker, table tennis and more.
 * Career building is part of the deal - Monthly personal development budget for you to invest in your development via professional memberships, literature, external certifications, conferences, AI subscriptions and more.
 * Events to foster culture - Regular company and team events like our yearly All Company trip to some place in Europe and local year-end celebrations as well as a team budget for team events on quarterly basis.

 * Your well-being matters - Receive generous mental health support via NILO, family leave and sabbatical opportunities with Jodel.
 * Discover Discounts and Partnerships - Save money with corporate discounts across brands like Adidas, LG, Bosch, Apple, and more.
 * United in diversity - with people from all over the world, from Egypt to France, from Finland to China, we are multicultural by default and proud to be so. We all come from different walks of life and cultural backgrounds, and we continue to push for diversity in our team!
   
   

About Us

Jodel was launched in 2014. The idea of Jodel started, when we realised that despite countless products in tech, there was no fast and simple way to connect with people around us.

You will be able to fully explore the city you live in, listen in on all its vibrant communities and connect with your peers. No matter if it’s other pet lovers nearby or the local techno crowd: Jodel allows you to share memes and jokes, get news, ask questions and simply have fun. You can discuss everything from new hypes to modern-dating, organize help for social causes. And by doing all that you might even get to know new amazing people in your area.

Jodel will be closing the gap to easily share a togetherness with all the people you see in the physical world. As this works in your hometown, so it does when moving somewhere else. Whenever you’re travelling, you can be certain there are people around you that wonder about the same things. Is it still worth it to go to the Full Moon party here in Ko Pha-ngan or what are the best tricks for negotiations on the Marrakech market? And maybe, one day, you think about moving to New York so you teleport to its local feed and explore.

Come as you are!

At Jodel everyone is welcome, regardless of gender identity, nationality, age, disability status, sexual orientation or religion. Jodel is an equal opportunity employer and believes that a great working environment reflects a diversity of backgrounds, experience, talent and thoughts. We will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. All you need is a passion for local communities and a desire to be part of a fast growing startup.

description:

Media Pioneer ist ein innovatives, digitales Medienunternehmen im Herzen Berlins mit Fokus auf unabhängigen Journalismus rund um Wirtschaft und Politik. Mit unserem einzigartigen Arbeitsort – dem ersten Medienschiff der Welt – bieten wir ein dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld direkt im Berliner Regierungsviertel.  * Du übernimmst Verantwortung für die Qualität unserer digitalen Produkte.

Was Du mitbringst


 * Du besitzt Neugierde und Begeisterungsfähigkeit für digitales Produktmanagement und mediale Inhalte.
 * Du bist analytisch und lösungsorientiert, mit der Fähigkeit, komplexe Probleme in überschaubare Häppchen zu unterteilen und zu lösen.
 * Du arbeitest gerne und effektiv in cross-funktionalen Teams und schätzt die Vielfalt unterschiedlicher Perspektiven und Meinungen.

Warum genau wir?

 * Du bekommst die Möglichkeit, regelmäßig an einem der außergewöhnlichsten Orte der Welt zu arbeiten: auf unseren Medienschiffen ThePioneer One, The Pioneer Two und natürlich unseren Medienbus - Klartext Express.

Was wir bieten


 * Du erhältst die Möglichkeit, in einem innovativen, wachsenden Medienunternehmen zu arbeiten und mit hoher Eigenverantwortung den Aufbau und die Weiterentwicklung von The Pioneer hands-on mitzugestalten.

 * The Pioneer befindet sich in einer spannenden Wachstumsphase, die dir zahlreiche Chancen für persönliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung bietet.
 * Du bekommst die Gelegenheit, regelmäßig an einem der außergewöhnlichsten Orte der Welt zu arbeiten: auf unseren Medienschiffen The Pioneer One, The Pioneer Two und natürlich unserem Medienbus – Klartext Express.

 * Du lernst von fantastischen Kollegen und Kolleginnen, die in ihrem Bereich zu den besten der Branche gehören, und arbeitest eng mit Gabor Steingart und dem Pioneer Allstar-Team zusammen.

Das Nachrichtenportal The Pioneer bildet seit Mai 2020 die gemeinsame Bühne für alle journalistischen Publikationen des Medienunternehmens Media Pioneer Publishing AG.

Als schwimmender Newsroom, Produktionsort und Bühne für Live-Journalismus dient unserer Crew das erste Medienschiff der Welt, The Pioneer 1, das täglich auf der Spree oder in ganz Deutschland unterwegs ist.

Unsere Mission heißt Unabhängigkeit: der Politik- und Wirtschaftsjournalismus von The Pioneer ist 100% werbefrei.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
The Company

Payrails is an innovative technology company with a team that has many years of experience in the payment industry and a real-life understanding of the merchants’ needs. We have seen the complexity firsthand and we have learned from all the challenges we've faced. Now we want to help leading technology companies around the world accept payments and build financial services with minimal upfront investments.

Our vision at Payrails is to reimagine payments. We do this by removing heavy reliance on Engineering efforts using composable building blocks that put the control firmly in the hands of our customers. We exist to help our customers become more productive and flexible, impacting directly on their ability to grow.

We are joined in our mission by top-tier investors Andreessen Horowitz , HV Capital, EQT and General Catalyst alongside a great cast of knowledgeable angel investors to enable us to solve the growing complexity of payments.

At Payrails, we are committed to building a team full of the most talented people. Excellence is part of our values and we understand that in order to achieve this, we need to build an environment where skilled people can work openly, collaboratively, and with the utmost trust in one another. We believe people thrive the most when they are fully aware of what the business is trying to achieve, why it is important to the market, and what challenges lie in the way to reaching our goals. In such an environment we believe people can truly excel, grow and enjoy working together. We try hard to be a company where everyone is inspired and feels a sense of responsibility to do the right thing to help us bring our vision to life. Succeeding with us is about finding solutions to the most pressing problems and executing them effectively.

Your Team

Payrails Is a Dynamic Workplace And Our Product Team Sits At The Core Of This Landscape. Our Mission Is To Drive a Successful Intersection Between User Experience, Technology And Business. We Do This By Focusing On 3 Main Pillars


 * Continuously studying our customers and the problems they are facing
 * Making sure we build a product that is feasible and best-in-class
 * Ensuring our product-market fit is always top of mind
   
   

Our Product team offers you the opportunity to work alongside a group of highly ambitious and knowledgeable Product Managers, while being faced with highly complex problems that affect customers on a global scale.

What You Will Be Doing

You as a Senior Product Manager, Intelligence will drive the product strategy for our Intelligence Product. You will be responsible for the end-to-end definition, scoping and development of the Payrails’ payments platform. You will own the roadmap, prioritization and setting of the technical vision for the team(s).


 * You will work directly with Engineering, Data and Business teams as well as external partners to meet Payrails’ product development targets
 * You will define and track success criteria and metrics to ensure product-market fit as well as constantly look for more efficient enhancing product performance
 * You will lead multiple cross-functional initiatives across the entire product lifecycle, partnering with business stakeholders to fully understand the problems faced by our customers and devise the right solutions to tackle them
 * You will be leading the scoping of initiatives at all levels from small improvements and bug fixes to large changes in the infrastructure and product
 * This role requires a technical person with strong communication skills, who can bridge the information gap between Business and Engineering teams. It will be this person’s responsibility to translate business objectives into clear technical scope for product development
 * You will be knowledgeable about the Payments market and will be actively involved in user, market and competitor research to ensure the best product-market fit
 * You will be responsible for the product-marketing strategy for your new product releases. Adoption of your products and features is a fundamental part of product delivery.
   
   

You'll be great for this role if

Mentorship: we care about your career aspirations and strive to assign projects based on your interests. You can learn and be curious with access to unlimited virtual trainings on project management, personal brand, communication skills and many more.

Extra perks for Amazonians such as: exclusive Amazon.de discount; Deutschlandticket (Transportation Ticket); bike rental; gym membership discount; Beta testing on new Amazon products; and free mental health, legal, and financial support for you and your family.

Get involved: we have with over 13 Amazon Affinity Groups you can join and become an ally to a cause close to your heart (sustainability, diversity, LGBTQ+, mental and/or physical disabilities, local community initiatives, etc.)

title: Product Manager (m/w/d)
description:
Warum L’Oréal?

Uns treibt die Leidenschaft für Schönheit, die die Welt bewegt.

Wir sind Marktführer in Beauty und Pionier im Bereich Beauty Tech. Als Folge der sich konstant verändernden Welt, sind für uns Kosmetik und Technologie untrennbar miteinander verbunden. Gemeinsam mit unseren Konsumenten und Partnern antizipieren wir Trends und gestalten Schönheit von morgen.

Wir leben Nachhaltigkeit und Umweltschutz. Unsere Verpflichtungen bis 2030 markieren den Beginn eines radikaleren Wandels und verkörpern unsere Auffassung darüber, wie die Vision, der Zweck und die Verantwortung eines Unternehmens aussehen sollten, um den Herausforderungen der Welt zu begegnen. Unsere 88.000 Mitarbeiter in 150 Ländern transformieren unser Business, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Aktivitäten die Grenzen unseres Planeten respektieren.

Wir suchen für unseren Standort Düsseldorf Mitarbeiter, die gemeinsam mit uns einen Unterschied machen wollen.

Ihre Aufgaben

Product Manager*innen besetzen wir ganzjährig, je nach Bedarf innerhalb eines unserer vier Vertriebskanäle Apotheke, Consumer Products, Luxus oder Professionelle Produkte.

In Ihrer Rolle als Product Manager*in steuern Sie, gemeinsam mit Ihrem Vorgesetzten, die lokale Business-Strategie Ihrer Marke oder Kategorie und damit das Wachstum von Konsumentenbasis, Marktanteil, Umsatz und Profit.

Hierbei Verantworten Sie Insbesondere Folgende Aspekte


 * Sie synthetisieren relevante Marktdaten und übersetzen diese, unter Berücksichtigung aktueller Trends, in relevante Konsumenten-Insights.
 * Darauf aufbauend, arbeiten Sie an der Ausrichtung Ihrer Marke/Kategorie, entwickeln disruptive integrierte Marketingkampagnen und zeigen dabei ausgeprägte Handels-und Shopper-Expertise sowie digitales Know-How.
 * Ihre 360°-Kampagnen steuern Sie mit einem hohen Maß an Professionalität, Agilität und Nachhaltigkeit durch.
 * Dabei agieren Sie extrem unternehmerisch, mobilisieren und steuern Ihre Stakeholder an internen und externen Schnittstellen durch. Best practices teilen Sie gerne und heben Sie auf das nächste Level.
 * Die Rolle beinhaltet keine Führung.
   
   

Ihr Profil




 * Mindestens 2-4 Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Product Management
 * Trends, neue
   
   

Produkte und Konsumentenverhalten beobachten Sie mit großer Neugier und lieben das hohe Tempo und die Dynamik unsere Branche


 * Sie haben eine starke „entrepreneurial attitude“ sowie ausgeprägten „Business-Sense“. Sie setzen sich ambitionierte Ziele, arbeiten fokussiert an Wegen, diese zu erreichen und zeigen dabei ein hohes Maß an Priorisierung.

 * Sie haben ständig neue und einzigartige Ideen und sind in der Lage, Verbindungen zwischen scheinbar unzusammenhängenden Ideen herzustellen.
 * In der Beziehung zu ihren Stakeholdern finden Sie schnell Gemeinsamkeiten und lösen Probleme zum Nutzen aller. Sie gewinnen schnell das Vertrauen und die Unterstützung Ihrer Kollegen, gelten als Team-Player und sind kooperativ.
 * Deutschkenntnisse auf C1-Niveau setzen wir voraus!
   
   
   
   

Unser Angebot


 * Eine unbefristete Arbeitsanstellung in einem krisenresistenten, wachsenden Markt mit einem umfassenden Angebot an Sozialleistungen
 * Eine attraktive und wettbewerbsorientierte Vergütung sowie ein freiwilliges Profitsharings

title: Senior Product Operations Manager (w/m/d)
description:
Company Description

You'll be joining one of the world’s largest privately owned real estate tech companies and a subsidiary of Axel Springer. Our mission is to unlock everyone’s perfect place! You'll work across some of Europe’s best known digital real estate brands including: 🇫🇷 Meilleurs Agents, 🇫🇷 Groupe SeLoger, 🇧🇪 Immoweb, 🇧🇪 Realo 🇩🇪 Immowelt, 🇩🇪 Neuraum and 🇮🇱 Yad2.

Job Description

WHAT WE DO IN PRODUCT OPERATIONS

In Product Operations, our mission is to enable the product and tech community to deliver value with an effective and recognized product culture, supported by optimised product development processes, best practices, ways of working, tools & training. We envision to become a best-in-class operational powerhouse that drives product excellence, fosters high speed innovation, and enables sustainable growth by defining efficient, scalable, and data-driven products and product iterations. The product operation team is distributed in 3 different countries (Germany, France, Belgium) allowing us to keep the pulse from the team and understand where they need support.

Job Overview

We are seeking an experienced Senior Product Operations Manager to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in enhancing and streamlining the digital product management delivery process within both B2B and B2C contexts. You will work closely with senior leadership, including Directors and C-Level executives, to drive continuous assessment, improvement, and harmonisation of product management practices across the organisation. This is a strategic role where you will focus on building efficient, scalable, and harmonised ways of working that empower product teams to deliver high-quality outcomes.

Key Responsibilities:


 * Process Improvement & Optimization
    * Lead initiatives to improve the efficiency and consistency of the product management delivery guild across B2B and B2C environments.
    * D/Refine, document, and implement standardised product management frameworks and workflows to ensure clear accountability and repeatable success.
    * Continuously assess and enhance processes related to product delivery, decision-making, and stakeholder alignment, ensuring scalability and growth readiness.
    * Own the Product Operations roadmap, ensuring a long-term vision for scaling and improving product management capabilities.

 * Harmonise Ways of Working
    * Lead initiatives to harmonise the ways of working across global product teams, ensuring that all processes are aligned with the company’s overarching strategy.
    * Introduce and refine tools, templates, and best practices to create a unified approach to product management in a multi-environment business model (B2B and B2C).

 * Continuous Assessment & Delivery Improvement
    * Lead efforts in continuous assessment and optimization of product delivery, including metrics, KPIs, and feedback loops that drive performance improvements.
    * Establish a culture of continuous improvement within the product management organisation, leveraging data and analytics to identify areas for optimization and innovation.
    * Ensure efficient discovery data resulting in high-quality initiatives to be prioritised in alignment with the company product roadmap.

 * Cross-Functional Collaboration
    * Engage with Senior Directors and C-level executives to drive product operations strategies that align with company goals and customer expectations.
    * Collaborate closely with Product, Engineering, Design, Product Marketing, and Operations teams to harmonise and streamline workflows, ensuring alignment on product goals and deliverables.
    * Facilitate cross-functional initiatives to improve roadmap prioritisation, capacity planning, and release management.
    * Act as a trusted advisor to the leadership team on operational excellence in product management, including insights and recommendations for continuous improvement.

 * Data-Driven Decision Making
    * Promote a culture of data-driven decision-making within product teams, empowering and enabling them to incorporate insights and metrics into their processes.
    * Utilise data and analytics to improve decision-making and streamline product operations.
    * Establish and oversee KPIs to track the efficiency and success of product delivery and operations.

 * Training & Mentorship
    * Provide leadership and mentorship to product managers, driving operational excellence and cross-functional collaboration.
      

Create and lead training programs for product management teams, enabling them to excel in their roles and align with operational goals.

Qualifications

Qualifications:


 * Strong experience in Product Operations or a related field or consulting background with a strong background in both B2B and B2C digital environments.
 * Demonstrated success working with senior leadership (Directors and C-level executives) to influence and drive product management and operational improvements.
 * Proven track record of improving product management processes and delivering continuous improvement within fast-paced organisations.
 * Strong experience in product delivery frameworks, including Agile and Lean methodologies.
 * Expertise in cross-functional collaboration with product, engineering, and business teams to optimise workflows and align on business goals.
 * Exceptional strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, with a focus on driving process improvements and harmonising operational practices within the different domains.
 * Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to influence and mentor product teams at all levels.
 * Data-driven mindset, with the ability to leverage insights to make informed decisions and drive continuous improvement.
 * Experience in scaling and/or transforming product operations in a growing organisation, particularly within the context of global or multi-market operations.
   
   

Preferred Skills:


 * Experience working in both B2B and B2C product environments.
 * Strong familiarity with product management tools such as Jira, Jira Product Discovery, Confluence, Productboard, or similar.
 * Ability to navigate complex international organisational structures and drive change across teams with diverse priorities.
   
   

Additional Information

About us

Product Manager: Spot & Futures Market Making

About Keyrock

Since our beginnings in 2017, we've grown to be a leading change-maker in the digital asset space, renowned for our partnerships and innovation.

Today, we rock with over 180 team members around the world. Our diverse team hails from 42 nationalities, with backgrounds ranging from DeFi natives to PhDs. Predominantly remote, we have hubs in London, Brussels and Singapore, and host regular online and offline hangouts to keep the crew tight.

We are trading on more than 80 exchanges, and working with a wide array of asset issuers. As a well-established market maker, our distinctive expertise led us to expand rapidly. Today, our services span market making, options trading, high-frequency trading, OTC, and DeFi trading desks.

But we’re more than a service provider. We’re an initiator. We're pioneers in adopting the Rust Development language for our algorithmic trading, and champions of its use in the industry. We support the growth of Web3 startups through our Accelerator Program. We upgrade ecosystems by injecting liquidity into promising DeFi, RWA, and NFT protocols. And we push the industry's progress with our research and governance initiatives.

At Keyrock, we're not just envisioning the future of digital assets. We're actively building it.

We're seeking a dedicated Product Manager to drive the architecture that powers our spot & futures market making system for cryptocurrency markets. This role focuses on navigating cryptocurrency markets, shaping our strategy for building low latency, high performance architecture and identifying opportunities to make our market making engine 100x more scalable across new frontiers.

title: Senior Product Manager, Extensions
description:
Grammarly offers a dynamic hybrid working model for this role. This flexible approach gives team members the best of both worlds: plenty of focus time along with in-person collaboration that helps foster trust, innovation, and a strong team culture.

About Grammarly

Grammarly is the world’s leading AI writing assistance company trusted by over 30 million people and 70,000 teams. From instantly creating a first draft to perfecting every message, Grammarly helps people at 96% of the Fortune 500 and teams at companies like Atlassian, Databricks, and Zoom get their point across—and get results—with best-in-class security practices that keep data private and protected. Founded in 2009, Grammarly is No. 14 on the Forbes Cloud 100, one of TIME’s 100 Most Influential Companies, one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in AI, and one of Inc.’s Best Workplaces.

The opportunity

To achieve our ambitious goals, we’re looking for a Product Manager to join our Browser Extensions team. Our browser extensions are the primary way that Grammarly’s millions of daily users interact with our product. As the product manager for the Browser Extension team, you’ll be responsible for ensuring that Grammarly’s writing assistant integrates seamlessly and delightfully everywhere our users write on the web.

As an experienced product manager, you’ll be responsible for how our users interact with Grammarly’s product on websites they often use—e.g., Gmail, Google Docs, Facebook, and Zendesk. The role will challenge your product, design, and technical skills as you ensure that Grammarly integrates harmoniously into our users’ workflows to support writing tasks as varied as drafting a novel or shooting off a sales email.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


 * Working across Grammarly to define and expand our definition and understanding of client quality, performance, and compatibility.
 * Devise metrics to measure the overall quality of the product experience and then refine Grammarly’s browser extensions to be world-class software—a particular challenge given the goal of integrating the product seamlessly across the entire web.
 * Be the guardian of user experience for our browser extensions. Many teams will contribute to the success of the product, and you will develop standards and processes to ensure a great result.
 * Develop the product roadmap and vision for Grammarly’s product on the web. To do so, you’ll need to combine a deep empathy for what our users go through when writing and develop creative and delightful solutions to their problems.
 * Using quality insights and data to influence roadmaps and drive improvements to our Browser-based experiences.
 * Presenting to engineering, product, and leadership on quality insights and strategic initiatives.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Has several years of experience working with Product Management.
 * Is able to drive learnings, execution, and impact in a product area with ambiguity.
 * Has a background in web, extension, and browser development practices and technologies
