title: Digital Product Leader (m/f/d) Supply Chain Development
description:
Company Description

You see things a little differently. So do we. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. We put togetherness at the heart of everything we do. Come see things a little differently with us.

IKEA is one of the world's leading home furnishing companies. Our vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible will be able to afford them.

IKEA Core Business Supply is responsible for securing that the product offer is produced and delivered to our customers. We lead the supply agenda across many functions and work together with all business areas, different business units, but also retail markets to secure customer availability in all markets and sales channels at lowest total cost.

Supply Chain Development (SCD) is one of the business units in Core Business Supply and we are on an exciting journey! By gathering the end-to-end supply chain development and innovation agenda into one organization, embedding management and development of processes and digital solutions into the business, we will meet the future with the right competences and business capabilities. By this we will also create the preconditions to a world class supply chain that enable IKEA to efficiently respond to the ever-changing customer needs.

Within the SCD Area Intralogistics Development organisation we are responsible to break it down and to establish, lead, support and develop logistics solutions for the various IKEA units that have a logistical and fulfilment component.

Job Description

As part of the SCD Area Intralogistics Development organisation’s assignment we connect internal IT specialists and external Service Partners to develop, operate and maintain need oriented, innovative IT solutions, kept up to date – both from technical and functional perspective. Furthermore, we globally support a huge number of Supply Chain Projects to make IKEA available for the many.

As a Digital Product Leader you are


 * Accountable for managing one or more assigned digital product(s), securing running business, development, support/service performance.
 * Accountable for the digital product vision and roadmap, supporting relevant process and capability goals, including life-cycle management and compliance to frameworks and standards.
 * Accountable for budget, prioritization, clear and transparent goals, and plans for the digital product(s).
 * Responsible to secure that the digital product(s) fulfils well defined business and user needs, including related learning offer.
 * Responsible to define the digital product scope, ways of working, and performance follow-up.
 * Responsible to lead both digital product development and discovery work to explore new opportunities, control cost, manage risks and dependencies, and to maximize business value.
 * Responsible for managing stakeholder engagement, e.g. with suppliers, super users, or user community, depending on digital product(s).
 * Responsible to identify and create measures of success to understand how the product achieves business outcomes.
 * Responsible to secure that the digital product team has access to relevant insights and maintains a deep understanding of both business context and user’s reality.
 * Contribute to adoption of best practice in digital product management and continually benchmark against industry standards.
   
   

Qualifications

You have a strong interest in supply chain and intralogistics as well as in technology, digitalization, and automation. You have a passion for planning and leading in a global assignment and to drive and develop the business and yourself to deliver excellent results. Moreover, you have a desire to collaborate and interact with various stakeholders.

You are a match for IKEA and this role when you:


 * Extensive knowledge in digital product development, agile development practices and ways of working.
 * Extensive knowledge in the relevant business context, IKEA business processes, strategies, and digital landscape.
 * Extensive knowledge in how to develop and lead a high performing autonomous team with a clear digital product vision, and working with relevant disciplines such as discovery, UX, and data driven decision making.
 * Ability to lead value based and develop business and people through IKEA leadership capabilities.
 * Ability to develop and lead a highly effective empowered digital product team focusing on customer/user insights, data-informed decisions, and impactful outcomes/value.
 * Ability to, in an excellent way, communicate, facilitate, listen actively, build networks, and inspire others.
 * Ability to stimulate creative ideas and to identify and act on opportunities for improvement
 * Passionate about creating value and digital products that users love.
 * High motivated by leading business and people together creating optimal preconditions for performance and growth.
 * Motivated by continuous improvement and learning.
 * Motivated to work in an environment of constant change.
 * Always committed to and guided by the IKEA Culture & Values.
 * Proven digital product management background combined with people leadership experience.
 * Experience in setting clear objectives and steering all involved people towards achieving results.
 * Strong and proven skills in communication, stakeholder management, and conflict resolution.
 * 5+ years in software development industry working with agile and DevOps.
 * Experience working in a global retail organization and/or IKEA value chain preferred.
   
   

Degree in computer science, business administration, engineering or similar is preferred

Additional Information

We offer you a position in a fast paced, truly global environment where development and constantly being on the way is in focus! And as the world’s leader at life at home, you have exceptional opportunities to grow together with us in an international network with future oriented projects and technical innovations. At IKEA, we value diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are committed to providing coworkers with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We encourage individualism and invite you to come join our team and be yourself with us!

The position is based in Dortmund, Germany and will require some travelling.

Submit your application online and in English via our recruitment system SmartRecruiters (please note that applications sent via e-mail will not be accepted) latest on the 5th of January 2025. If you have any questions about the actual recruitment process, please send a message to our recruiting team via SmartRecruiters and we will come back to you. In case of questions connected to the role, please reach out to hiring manager Udo Hilbk (udo.hilbk@inter.ikea.com).

At IKEA, we continuously look for better ways of working, following our vision to create a better everyday life for the many people. It is in our culture to work together and to be open, straightforward, and inclusive. We welcome all applications. Our culture and values are based on equal opportunities, and we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

We are looking forward to hearing from you soon!

title: Product Manager
description:
Making life accessible




Join the smart locking revolution! iLOQ is an international company headquartered in Finland that offers intelligent locking systems and total access management solutions. We guarantee safe access to buildings and facilities. Our mission is to make everyday life easier with a diverse range of safe and sustainable products for individual buildings and large real estate complexes.

ILOQ is dedicated to challenging conventional thinking and pushing the boundaries of innovation. Our products are based on unique battery-free, patented technologies, and we are now seeking an experienced Product Manager to develop and maintain our DIN/Euro Profile product portfolio to meet our ambitious growth targets. A convenient location for the job is in Central Europe.




What you’ll do




As our Product Manager, your responsibility is focused on three main topics:




Commercial

 * Supporting effective sales and marketing development together with sales, marketing & service (i.e., value proposition, events and fairs, brochures, specification, technical documentation, training material, product content, etc.)
 * Contributing to product launches and market introductions with marketing and sales
 * Supporting sales team in executing growth and Go to Market plans within targeted segments through partner engagement, new business opportunities and customer interaction
 * Supporting local sales in business opportunities including customer interaction




Financial

 * Developing target market product pricing and positioning based on business and customer impact
 * Supporting financial position of product portfolio through revenue, cost and margin management
 * Sharing and communicating the product life-cycle journey in respective market areas




Technical

 * Developing and maintain DIN/Euro Profile product portfolio for target segments ensuring time-to-market, product quality and features
 * New product introduction and trainings for sales




What you’ll bring




We feel the best match for this role will be a candidate with strong experience of locking and digital access management products and their applications. You also have a passion to support sales and customers and motivate people through good leadership and personal commitment. This position also requires excellent communication and organizational capabilities.




We are looking for a Product Manager with following qualifications:




 * Appropriate engineering degree or similar
 * At least 5 years of experience in product portfolio development and management or related function i.e., technical management/support, R&D, operations, marketing, or sales
 * Experience of locking and digital access management products and their applications
 * Excellent communication and negotiation skills in English and preferably in German, other language skills are an asset
 * Flexible attitude and ability to perform under pressure. You are also a team player, well organized and proactive




We believe in people




With iLOQ, everyone can make an impact. Our values guide our operations: We change the market, challenge the traditional way of thinking, believe in people, and base our actions on sustainable development, respect and results.




With us you will have a genuine opportunity to make a real difference in a fast-growing international company and influence the work environment of the entire company. We invest in the training and development of our employees so that we can shake the boundaries of innovation, design new technology and create even better solutions that provide excellent added value for our customers. We will take care of you by providing excellent onboarding experience with friendly, helpful, and passionate colleagues.




Are you the person we are looking for?




If you're passionate about innovation and are ready to take on a challenging and rewarding role, we would love to hear from you. Apply today to join ILOQ and be a part of our team pushing the boundaries of technology and security. For more information of the role please contact our HW Product Management Director Trond Wiker (firstname.lastname@iloq.com).




We are expecting your application by December 21st at the latest. Please note, that we will be reviewing candidates and conducting interviews already during the application process.

title: (Senior) Product Owner - Payment/Search (all genders)
description:
Your role

We are looking for a strategic Product Owner to lead the development and optimization of Search or Payment functionalities across our platforms. You will drive improvements in search accuracy and relevancy through AI/ML solutions, while also ensuring seamless, secure payment transactions and optimized user flows. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you'll define and prioritize product roadmaps to enhance both user experiences and business outcomes. If you're passionate about shaping user-centric products and driving impactful results, we want to hear from you!

Product Owner - Search


 * Lead the strategy, development, and optimization of search functionality across our platforms.
 * Define and prioritize the product backlog to enhance search accuracy, relevancy, and user satisfaction.
 * Collaborate with engineering, UX, and data teams to implement AI/ML solutions for search personalization.
 * Analyze user behavior and search metrics to identify areas of improvement and opportunities for innovation.
   
   

Product Owner - Payment


 * Oversee the end-to-end management of payment solutions, ensuring seamless and secure transactions.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to define payment product requirements and roadmap.
 * Work closely with compliance and legal teams to ensure adherence to regulations.
 * Optimize payment flows to improve user experience and reduce drop-off rates.
   
   

Your profile


 * At least 5 years experience as a (Senior) Product Owner/Manager or similar role in a technology-driven environment.
 * Strong domain knowledge in either search systems (e.g., Elasticsearch, Algolia) or payment systems (e.g., payment gateways, PCI compliance).
 * Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
 * Data-driven mindset with experience using analytics tools to inform decisions.
 * Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools like Jira, Confluence, or similar.
 * Likes to work in a Hybrid work set up, as we value spending time together in the office.
 * This position is on-site in Berlin, we don't offer remote work for this position.
 * English full professional working proficiency, ideally German too.
   
   

What we offer


 * An appealing discount on all of our products – from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients
 * We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year
 * The Urban Sports Club membership and either Swapfiets bike rental or a subsidy for the Deutschlandticket
 * A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a hybrid work model and 'workation'
 * Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia
 * You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas
 * Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world
 * We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day
   
   

Apply for this job

About Us

Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy – as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations.

We take our ecological responsibility very seriously: Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable.

We have a diverse team of 220 people and 37 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.

We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don’t match with 100% of the requirements.

title: Senior Manager of Product Management
description:
Unser Mandant ist eines der weltweit führenden und forschungsorientierten Pharmaunternehmen und beschäftigt über 100.000 Mitarbeiter in über 120 Ländern. Zum Frühjahr 2025 suchen wir eine engagierte Persönlichkeit als




Product Management Lead (m/w/d)

In Festanstellung, überwiegend vor Ort in Baden-Württemberg




Als Product Management Lead (m/w/d) mit dem Aufgabenschwerpunkt COPD arbeiten und bewegen Sie sich in einem dynamischen, spannenden und kompetitiven Marktumfeld. title: Product Manager in Operations
description:
FINN drives change for people, organizations and the planet through frictionless mobility. Offering convenient and flexible car subscriptions, we bring a true e-commerce experience to car ownership and accelerate the arrival of electric mobility. Join our fast-growing scale-up to make FINN the natural choice in Germany. We work with the best car brands in the world and are backed by leading global investors.

Your Role

As Product Manager for our Active Fleet Product team, you will be responsible for the end-to-end product process from setting the vision to understanding our biggest challenges to delivering your new ideas. You ensure that we have a seamless best-in-class customer experience and our processes are running silky-smooth and are highly scalable. This includes building integrations with our partners, internal tools for our Fleet Managers, and customer-facing solutions. In short: You enable us to provide the best customer experience for more than 50,000 cars on the road!

Why FINN?


 * Flexibility to work either in our Munich office or remotely ±1 hours of the CET/CEST timezone.
 * Relocation support for you and your family.
 * Excellent fixed salary, significant virtual equity share of the company, along a yearly personal development budget of 1,500€.
 * An open-minded community to be welcomed from day one and fun team events with amazing colleagues.
 * Access to discounted gym memberships and attractive mobility options (e.g. discounts for FINN cars via JobAuto or tax benefits via JobRad).
   
   
   

Your Responsibilities


 * Own the product vision and roadmap for our Active Fleet Product: Shape all product decisions for our Active Fleet that influence the experience of our customers as well as efficiency of our Fleet Managers. With your expertise, you ensure smooth processes and provide transparency about every car being with our customers.
 * Develop and leverage a deep understanding of processes: Build in-depth knowledge of our processes, including close collaboration with our external partners, and customers’ needs through direct engagement and data analysis. Understand where we can optimize our processes and improve our customer experience.
 * Share your knowledge and enable your peers: You collaborate closely with your multi-disciplinary team of Engineering, Automation Manager, and Data in the Operations Department to build and iterate on your products together, closely collaborating with business stakeholders. You close the feedback loop and nurture alignment to create a shared vision.
 * Critically question and analyze: With your profound product management skills, your team is responsible for building and enabling technology that solves user issues and achieves team goals. Working jointly with the team’s Engineering Manager, you prioritize and define requirements to bring our systems to the next level, while always seizing opportunities for automation.
   
   
   

Your Profile


 * Fluency in German and English is a must.
 * Experience in product management, collaborating with technical and business teams.
 * Previous experience in an agile, high-growth environment, preferably logistics, fleet management, mobility, or similar.
 * Entrepreneurial mindset, with a passion for building both functional and beloved internal and customer-facing tools in close partnership with the users.
 * Highly structured and analytical working style with demonstrated experience in turning data into actionable insights. Data is your friend and validator.
 * Outstanding communication skills and the ability to break down complex issues into understandable and actionable steps, especially also in working with external suppliers and partners.
 * Strong growth mindset and the motivation to continuously deliver value with a lean mindset.
   
   
   

€50,000 - €73,000 a year

Associate Product Manager €50,000 to €63,000

Product Manager €63,000 to €73,000

Factors that may influence an employee's pay within this range include, but are not limited to, their experience, skills, qualifications, certifications, education level, seniority, and performance. The compensation for this role will be within the range of €50,000 to €73,000 + VSOP, depending on the factors described above, as assessed during the interview process. This is the lowest and highest salary that we in good faith believe to be fair for this role at the time of this posting. This compensation range may be subject to change in the future.

title: Technical Product Manager (m/w/d)
description:
What we do

Better breast cancer screening should be a universal offering to every woman in the world. Vara’s AI-powered software platform, created with screening radiologists in Germany, mitigates much of the human subjectivity associated with reading mammography results—and reduces the repetitive work screening physicians are routinely subjected to—we’re making breast cancer screening more effective, more measurable, and more accessible for everyone, everywhere. By democratizing access to early screening around the world, we deliver measurable impact backed by clinical evidence. We are partnering globally, to deliver breast cancer screening where it is needed most.

As the first company from Europe’s leading AI venture studio Merantix, Vara has grown since 2018 to become a 50-member international team. Our diverse team consists of highly motivated and ambitious entrepreneurs, healthcare professionals, and technology experts.

Further information can be found on our website: www.vara.ai

Your role

As a Product Manager (m/w/d) You Will Report To Our Head Of Product And Take Over The Day To Day Of Our Radiologist Workflow Solution. Some Of Your Tasks Will Include


 * Conduct product research and exploration with relevant stakeholders.
 * Participate in UI/UX discussions to deliver maximum value to our users.
 * Coordinate feature releases and monitor their post-release adoption and user feedback.
 * Maintain regulatory documentation to ensure continuous compliance of our medical devices.
 * Support quality assurance efforts and proactively search for bugs and product improvements.
 * Participate in and contribute to strategic discussions around the product and its roadmap.
 * Work closely with stakeholders from different teams (Ops, Regulatory, QA, UI/UX, ML, Dev) representing Product and ensuring that we reach our milestones successfully.
   
   

Your profile


 * Higher education degree in computer science, medical technologies, (software) engineering, or business with strong affinity for technology.
 * Initial professional experience (e.g. through internships) at a VC-backed startup, management consultancy or in a similar fast-paced environment.
 * Excellent comprehension and analytical skills, exceptional commitment and communication skills and proven ability as an innovation driver.
 * Strong detail orientation, ability to think outside of the box, and capacity to manage multiple projects in parallel in a highly dynamic and ever changing work environment.
 * Proven ability to coordinate and take ownership within interdisciplinary teams to take key projects over the finish line.
 * Fluency in English and German
 * Professional or academic touchpoints with at least three out of the five following domains:
    * Software development
    * Business development
    * Startup / Innovation / Design Thinking
    * Artificial Intelligence
    * Medical Technologies
      

What we offer


 * Work flexibly In-office? From home? Somewhere in between? Whatever you prefer.
 * Team Culture We host regular team nights and events to foster company culture and cohesion.
 * Connect at our AI Campus Meet some truly exceptional humans at the AI campus — home to countless inspiring startups, events, and opportunities to broaden your horizons.
 * Competitive salary We regularly benchmark salaries within the tech and healthcare industry.
 * Develop your career Dedicate yourself to impactful projects and have regular, meaningful career development sessions with your manager.
   
   

Apply for this job

About Us

We are an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity. We consider all applications equally, regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity. We strongly encourage individuals from groups that are traditionally underrepresented in tech to apply.

Additionally, we provide immigration assistance for those who need it.
